intro: Triaspis angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often spiny structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Triaspis angolensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
